N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 321.6 - Annual financial statements of directors

State Regulations

Every director of a bank who is obligated on any loan or
extension of credit made by such bank to such director or to any other
individual, partnership or unincorporated association or corporation, shall
file a statement of his or her financial condition with such bank at least once
in each year and at such other times as the superintendent may require. This
section shall not apply to directors whose obligations are secured by
collateral having an ascertained market value of at least 15 percent more than
the amount of such obligations. Notes
